{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operations Assistant",
  "description": "EHA Clinics, a subsidiary of eHealth Africa, is a health care network operating across Nigeria that provides high-quality, innovative, data-driven, and technology-enabled services. EHA Clinics delivers a comprehensive range of state of the art health care services in each location, e.g,&nbsp; general consultations, laboratory investigations, pharmaceuticals, annual medical checks, child wellness checks, ultrasonography, and specialized services (urgent care, telemedicine, home care, dental care, and ophthalmology).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Sangotedo, Lagos&nbsp;
Department: Operations
Reports to:&nbsp;Clinical Operations Manager

Mission Objective


	Clinical services operations department is responsible for the smooth running of the clinics, by providing support to the medical team to ensure the delivery of quality healthcare.
	The operations assistant manages appointment schedules for both the patient and doctor ensuring that patient wait times are kept at the minimum.
	They also provide information about the services and products of the Clinics when visitors make an enquiries as well as handling patient billing.


Duties and Responsibilities
Purpose:


	Attends to patients at the clinic, triaging and classifying patients for optimal care create, update, and maintain low-level records and databases related to Odoo, EHA Care etc
	Ensuring the smooth running of the clinical operation in the clinics thereby encouraging a high patient flow and adherence to schedules.&nbsp;
	Sales of clinical products such as membership packages e.t.c
	Scheduling appointments and keeping track of patient wait time, Initiate prompt communication and reminders with patients on appointments through SMS, phone calls, emails etc.


Engagement:


	Providing information about the services and products of the Clinics when visitors make an enquiry.&nbsp;
	Acts as liaison person between the patient and other departments. Resolving queries and requests from the patients to the laboratory, medical and pharmacy teams.
	Act as liaison officers between HMO clients and EHA Clinics; confirming patient eligibility, seeking approvals, pre-authorizations and service coverage enquiries from the HMOs.


Delivery:


	Patient billing management- receipt of payments from clients and HMOs via various payment methods not limited to cash payments, bank transfers, POS e.t.c&nbsp;
	Supports managers and employees through a variety of tasks related to organization and communication
	Accomplishing organizational goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.


Targeted Specialized Knowledge&nbsp;


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or an OND in Business Administration, Office Management &amp; Technology, Public Administration, Secretarial Studies, or any management-related field.
	Minimum of one year experience handling roles as a Personal Assistant, Front Desk Executive, and Customer Service in any reputable company.


Key Area Of Note:


	Keep up to date with relevant medical research, technology, and evidence-based medical practice by attending continuing education courses and professional meetings, reading journals, etc.
	Research unusual symptoms and treatment options, through consultation with physicians and other medical specialists.


Remuneration
NGN 100,000 / Month (Gross).",
  "datePosted": "2025-07-17",
  "validThrough": "1600-07-17",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "EHA Clinics"
    
  },

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

}


Operations Assistant Job at EHA Clinics




        
    

        
        EHA Clinics, a subsidiary of eHealth Africa, is a health care network operating across Nigeria that provides high-quality, innovative, data-driven, and technology-enabled services. EHA Clinics delivers a comprehensive range of state of the art health care services in each location, e.g,  general consultations, laboratory investigations, pharmaceuticals, annual medical checks, child wellness checks, ultrasonography, and specialized services (urgent care, telemedicine, home care, dental care, and ophthalmology).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Assistant

Job Location: Sangotedo, Lagos 
Department: Operations
Reports to: Clinical Operations Manager
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Mission Objective


	Clinical services operations department is responsible for the smooth running of the clinics, by providing support to the medical team to ensure the delivery of quality healthcare.
	The operations assistant manages appointment schedules for both the patient and doctor ensuring that patient wait times are kept at the minimum.
	They also provide information about the services and products of the Clinics when visitors make an enquiries as well as handling patient billing.


Duties and Responsibilities
Purpose:


	Attends to patients at the clinic, triaging and classifying patients for optimal care create, update, and maintain low-level records and databases related to Odoo, EHA Care etc
	Ensuring the smooth running of the clinical operation in the clinics thereby encouraging a high patient flow and adherence to schedules. 
	Sales of clinical products such as membership packages e.t.c
	Scheduling appointments and keeping track of patient wait time, Initiate prompt communication and reminders with patients on appointments through SMS, phone calls, emails etc.


Engagement:


	Providing information about the services and products of the Clinics when visitors make an enquiry. 
	Acts as liaison person between the patient and other departments. Resolving queries and requests from the patients to the laboratory, medical and pharmacy teams.
	Act as liaison officers between HMO clients and EHA Clinics; confirming patient eligibility, seeking approvals, pre-authorizations and service coverage enquiries from the HMOs.


Delivery:


	Patient billing management- receipt of payments from clients and HMOs via various payment methods not limited to cash payments, bank transfers, POS e.t.c 
	Supports managers and employees through a variety of tasks related to organization and communication
	Accomplishing organizational goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.


Targeted Specialized Knowledge 


	Bachelor’s Degree or an OND in Business Administration, Office Management & Technology, Public Administration, Secretarial Studies, or any management-related field.
	Minimum of one year experience handling roles as a Personal Assistant, Front Desk Executive, and Customer Service in any reputable company.


Key Area Of Note:


	Keep up to date with relevant medical research, technology, and evidence-based medical practice by attending continuing education courses and professional meetings, reading journals, etc.
	Research unusual symptoms and treatment options, through consultation with physicians and other medical specialists.


Remuneration
NGN 100,000 / Month (Gross).    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Fleet Officer (Refurbishment Lead)",
  "description": "Max Drive - We are a team of passionate people and a leading technology-enabled company driven by a vision to solve the mobility challenges in Africa. We want to get people and goods to their destinations hitch-free. It is personal for us because we understand the frustration of epileptic transportation. We are making mobility safe, affordable, accessible, and sustainable through the deployment of high-performance technologies and operators.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Fleet Officer (Refurbishment Lead)

Job Location:&nbsp;Osogbo, Osun
Job type:&nbsp;Full time (On-site)
Category:&nbsp;Vehicle Operations

Description


	Ensure all costs relating to vehicle refurbishment are documented correctly to aid in repricing of vehicle
	Document Assessment records for all churned vehicles Responsible for the management of all churned vehicles
	Assess all vehicles and determine the refurbishment requirements
	Analyse cost for refurbishment for action by the Vehicle Maintenance Manager
	Ensure timely recertification of all churned vehicles to meet SOP requirements
	Ensure Refurbishment Operations are focused and aligned with MAX&rsquo;s business goals
	Ensure timely recertification of all deactivated vehicles to meet the timelines specified in the SOP documents.
	Supervise the check-out process of recertified vehicles
	Ensure adherence to rules and regulations for the refurbishment teams
	Create, fill, and manage job cards for churned vehicles marked for refurbishment
	Document all refurbished vehicles on the appropriate Application and ensure that adequate data is provided for pricing and reactivation
	Develop and maintain effective relationships with all staff.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND in any Engineering discipline.
	Mechanical Engineering is Preferred
	3 Years cognate experience as a vehicle technician or 2 years experience in Fleet Maintenance
	Strong interpersonal and communication(written and oral) skills
	Excellent understanding of Inventory Control principles and practices
	Proficient in MS Office/Google Workspace
	Good understanding of fleet management
	Critical and Analytical thinking
	Accuracy and Attention to detail
	Confidentiality and Thoroughness.


Benefits


	Competitive pay &amp; benefits
	Premium Health insurance cover
	Consistent Learning and Development

Fleet Officer (Refurbishment Lead) Job at Max Drive




        
    

        
        Max Drive - We are a team of passionate people and a leading technology-enabled company driven by a vision to solve the mobility challenges in Africa. We want to get people and goods to their destinations hitch-free. It is personal for us because we understand the frustration of epileptic transportation. We are making mobility safe, affordable, accessible, and sustainable through the deployment of high-performance technologies and operators.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer (Refurbishment Lead)

Job Location: Osogbo, Osun
Job type: Full time (On-site)
Category: Vehicle Operations

Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Ensure all costs relating to vehicle refurbishment are documented correctly to aid in repricing of vehicle
	Document Assessment records for all churned vehicles Responsible for the management of all churned vehicles
	Assess all vehicles and determine the refurbishment requirements
	Analyse cost for refurbishment for action by the Vehicle Maintenance Manager
	Ensure timely recertification of all churned vehicles to meet SOP requirements
	Ensure Refurbishment Operations are focused and aligned with MAX’s business goals
	Ensure timely recertification of all deactivated vehicles to meet the timelines specified in the SOP documents.
	Supervise the check-out process of recertified vehicles
	Ensure adherence to rules and regulations for the refurbishment teams
	Create, fill, and manage job cards for churned vehicles marked for refurbishment
	Document all refurbished vehicles on the appropriate Application and ensure that adequate data is provided for pricing and reactivation
	Develop and maintain effective relationships with all staff.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND in any Engineering discipline.
	Mechanical Engineering is Preferred
	3 Years cognate experience as a vehicle technician or 2 years experience in Fleet Maintenance
	Strong interpersonal and communication(written and oral) skills
	Excellent understanding of Inventory Control principles and practices
	Proficient in MS Office/Google Workspace
	Good understanding of fleet management
	Critical and Analytical thinking
	Accuracy and Attention to detail
	Confidentiality and Thoroughness.


Benefits


	Competitive pay & benefits
	Premium Health insurance cover
	Consistent Learning and Development
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Mobile Engineer (Swift)",
  "description": "Kuda is a full service, app-based digital bank. Our mission is to be the go-to bank not just for those living on the African continent, but also for the African diaspora wherever they might live, anywhere in the world. Kuda is free of ridiculous banking charges and great at helping customers budget, spend smartly and save more. We raised the largest seed round ever seen in Africa, and completed a Series A funding round in February 2021, led by some of the world&#39;s smartest venture capital investors. With offices in London (our HQ), Lagos and Cape Town, and further offices opening across Africa during 2021, Kuda is fast becoming recognised as the leading &#39;Neobank&#39; for Africans.

To help us grow into the company that can bring meaningful change to the way people across Africa get access to great financial products and services in order to take control of their personal finances, we are actively looking for bright, talented, driven people who are excited by our mission. If this sounds like a great way to spend your valuable time, then please get in touch with us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Mobile Engineer (Swift)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Summary


	We are looking for a result-driven and analytical software engineer to work on our native iOS mobile application.
	You&#39;ll use your sound understanding of programming tools and languages to analyze current codes, formulate more efficient processes, solve problems and create a fantastic experience for users.


Roles and responsibilities


	Design and build applications for the iOS platform
	Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
	Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
	Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent experience
	2+ years of industry experience (ideally working in a start-up or scale-up)
	Proficiency with UIKit/SwiftUI in building user interfaces
	Experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation
	Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
	Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services
	Knowledge of other web technologies and UI/UX standards
	Understanding of Apple&rsquo;s design principles and human interface guidelines
	Experience with performance and memory management tools such as Profile Instruments
	Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
	Proficient understanding of code versioning tools
	Familiar with CI/CD.


Benefits
At Kuda, our people are the heart of our business, so we prioritize your welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including but not limited to:


	A great and upbeat work environment populated by a multinational team
	Pension

	Group life insurance
	Medical insurance
	Well-fare package (Wedding, Compassionate and etc)
	Perkbox
	Goal - employee wellness app
	Award winning L&amp;D training
	We are advocates of work-life balance, working in a hybrid in office schedule.

Mobile Engineer (Swift) Job at Kuda Bank




        
    

        
        Kuda is a full service, app-based digital bank. Our mission is to be the go-to bank not just for those living on the African continent, but also for the African diaspora wherever they might live, anywhere in the world. Kuda is free of ridiculous banking charges and great at helping customers budget, spend smartly and save more. We raised the largest seed round ever seen in Africa, and completed a Series A funding round in February 2021, led by some of the world's smartest venture capital investors. With offices in London (our HQ), Lagos and Cape Town, and further offices opening across Africa during 2021, Kuda is fast becoming recognised as the leading 'Neobank' for Africans.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



To help us grow into the company that can bring meaningful change to the way people across Africa get access to great financial products and services in order to take control of their personal finances, we are actively looking for bright, talented, driven people who are excited by our mission. If this sounds like a great way to spend your valuable time, then please get in touch with us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mobile Engineer (Swift)

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Summary


	We are looking for a result-driven and analytical software engineer to work on our native iOS mobile application.
	You'll use your sound understanding of programming tools and languages to analyze current codes, formulate more efficient processes, solve problems and create a fantastic experience for users.


Roles and responsibilities


	Design and build applications for the iOS platform
	Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
	Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
	Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent experience
	2+ years of industry experience (ideally working in a start-up or scale-up)
	Proficiency with UIKit/SwiftUI in building user interfaces
	Experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation
	Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
	Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services
	Knowledge of other web technologies and UI/UX standards
	Understanding of Apple’s design principles and human interface guidelines
	Experience with performance and memory management tools such as Profile Instruments
	Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
	Proficient understanding of code versioning tools
	Familiar with CI/CD.


Benefits
At Kuda, our people are the heart of our business, so we prioritize your welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including but not limited to:


	A great and upbeat work environment populated by a multinational team
	Pension
	Career development & growth
	Competitive annual leave plus bank holidays
	Competitive paid time off (Parental, Moving day, Birthday, Study leave etc)
	Group life insurance
	Medical insurance
	Well-fare package (Wedding, Compassionate and etc)
	Perkbox
	Goal - employee wellness app
	Award winning L&D training
	We are advocates of work-life balance, working in a hybrid in office schedule.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Control Officer",
  "description": "At Elvaridah, we emphasize on the critical matters and prospects of organizations such as business growth, strategy, planning, marketing, structure, and people management across different industries. We help companies focus on the growth of their businesses while aligning costs with strategy. With our all-inclusive approach and expertise, we capture values across the boundaries of any organization. Elvaridah focuses on optimizing all the different parts of a business as a unit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Quality Control Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Laundry &amp; Garment Care

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Quality Control Officer to ensure that all garments and laundry items meet our company&rsquo;s quality standards before they are delivered to customers.
	The ideal candidate will have strong attention to detail, an understanding of garment handling and fabric care, and a commitment to maintaining service excellence.


Key Responsibilities


	Inspect laundered items for cleanliness, proper ironing/pressing, and damage before packaging and delivery.
	Monitor each stage of the laundry process to ensure standards are met (washing, drying, ironing, folding).
	Identify and report defects such as stains, tears, discoloration, or shrinkage.
	Ensure garments are matched with the correct customer tags and packed appropriately.
	Collaborate with wash floor and ironing teams to improve handling processes.
	Document and report recurring quality issues and suggest process improvements.
	Train or brief staff on quality expectations and proper garment handling.
	Ensure hygiene, cleanliness, and safety standards are maintained throughout the laundry facility.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE / OND; additional training in textile care or quality assurance is a plus.
	At least 1 year of previous experience in a laundry, garment care, or housekeeping environment preferred.
	Good understanding of different fabric types and appropriate treatment methods.
	Strong attention to detail and a disciplined approach to work.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced and physically active environment.
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Salary
N100,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates sould send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@elvaridah.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "1600-07-17",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Elvaridah"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

}


Quality Control Officer Job at Elvaridah




        
    

        
        At Elvaridah, we emphasize on the critical matters and prospects of organizations such as business growth, strategy, planning, marketing, structure, and people management across different industries. We help companies focus on the growth of their businesses while aligning costs with strategy. With our all-inclusive approach and expertise, we capture values across the boundaries of any organization. Elvaridah focuses on optimizing all the different parts of a business as a unit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Laundry & Garment Care

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Quality Control Officer to ensure that all garments and laundry items meet our company’s quality standards before they are delivered to customers.
	The ideal candidate will have strong attention to detail, an understanding of garment handling and fabric care, and a commitment to maintaining service excellence.


Key Responsibilities


	Inspect laundered items for cleanliness, proper ironing/pressing, and damage before packaging and delivery.
	Monitor each stage of the laundry process to ensure standards are met (washing, drying, ironing, folding).
	Identify and report defects such as stains, tears, discoloration, or shrinkage.
	Ensure garments are matched with the correct customer tags and packed appropriately.
	Collaborate with wash floor and ironing teams to improve handling processes.
	Document and report recurring quality issues and suggest process improvements.
	Train or brief staff on quality expectations and proper garment handling.
	Ensure hygiene, cleanliness, and safety standards are maintained throughout the laundry facility.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE / OND; additional training in textile care or quality assurance is a plus.
	At least 1 year of previous experience in a laundry, garment care, or housekeeping environment preferred.
	Good understanding of different fabric types and appropriate treatment methods.
	Strong attention to detail and a disciplined approach to work.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced and physically active environment.
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Salary
N100,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates sould send their CV to: careers@elvaridah.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Hotel Cashier",
  "description": "Venmac Resources Limited - Our client, Golden Alpine Hotel, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Cashier

Job Location:&nbsp;Yola, Adamawa&nbsp;
Reports Directly to: Internal Auditor/ The Accountant.

Main Function&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;


	Receiving, dispensing and safe guarding cash


Areas of Responsibility


	
	As part of the front-end operations team, the Cashier is responsible for maintaining outstanding guest service as per hotel standards, processing sales quickly, accurately and efficiently.&nbsp;
	


Specific Duties and Activities


	Count money in cash drawers at the beginning of shifts to ensure that amounts are correct and that there is adequate change.
	Establish or identify prices of goods, services and tabulate bills using calculators and cash registers.
	Assisting with guest calls, inquiries and disputes.
	Attend all departmental meetings, briefings &amp; internal or external training sessions as required.
	The restaurant cashier&rsquo;s job description covers interacting with customers and accepting payment from them for products and services provided.
	Act wholeheartedly in the interests of the Company at all times &amp; not to perform, arrange or carry out any work or activity which could be considered to be in competition with or affect in any way the company interests or be detrimental or damaging to its public image.
	Receive payments and present change to customers.
	Cash handling.
	Balancing account at the end of every shift or sells.
	Communicate guest requests to management.
	Any other tasks as assigned from time to time by any manager.
	Good working knowledge of eZee hospitality solutions.
	Any other assigned duty by the management.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications and work experience.


Salary
N30,000 - N50,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;venmachospitality@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Hotel Cashier Job at Venmac Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Venmac Resources Limited - Our client, Golden Alpine Hotel, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Cashier

Job Location: Yola, Adamawa 
Reports Directly to: Internal Auditor/ The Accountant.

Main Function               


	Receiving, dispensing and safe guarding cash


Areas of Responsibility
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	
	As part of the front-end operations team, the Cashier is responsible for maintaining outstanding guest service as per hotel standards, processing sales quickly, accurately and efficiently. 
	


Specific Duties and Activities


	Count money in cash drawers at the beginning of shifts to ensure that amounts are correct and that there is adequate change.
	Establish or identify prices of goods, services and tabulate bills using calculators and cash registers.
	Assisting with guest calls, inquiries and disputes.
	Attend all departmental meetings, briefings & internal or external training sessions as required.
	The restaurant cashier’s job description covers interacting with customers and accepting payment from them for products and services provided.
	Act wholeheartedly in the interests of the Company at all times & not to perform, arrange or carry out any work or activity which could be considered to be in competition with or affect in any way the company interests or be detrimental or damaging to its public image.
	Receive payments and present change to customers.
	Cash handling.
	Balancing account at the end of every shift or sells.
	Communicate guest requests to management.
	Any other tasks as assigned from time to time by any manager.
	Good working knowledge of eZee hospitality solutions.
	Any other assigned duty by the management.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications and work experience.


Salary
N30,000 - N50,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: venmachospitality@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
